subject: RE: [junit] Commons Logging, Log4J and JUnit
msgSnippet: Also, what do you see what you add a line to your log4j.properties file that says: log4j.debug=true ? You should see extra debugging output in this case which

Also, what do you see what you add a line to your log4j.properties file
tha=
t says:

log4j.debug=3Dtrue

? 

You should see extra debugging output in t=
his case which will help you
debug your configuration problem.


Todd.
ps. =
 This really isn't a JUnit issue.  This is the kind of question that
pops u=
p every day on the log4j email list
(log4j-user@...).

> Where is your log4j.propert=
ies file? It needs to be 
> accessible on the classpath. Alternatively, you=
 can specify 
> its location explicitly by setting the /log4j.configuration=
/ 
> System property.
> 
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: junit@yahoo=
groups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] 
> On Behalf Of

> >
> >On 12/13/05,=
 chrlsberger <charles@...> wrote:
> >> I am writing some unit=
 test classes for a project I'm 
> working on.  I 
> >> use Apache Commons =
Logging as a wrapper for Log4J but I 
> keep getting 
> >> the following er=
ror messages when I run the tests:
> >>
> >> log4j:WARN No appenders could =
be found for logger 
> >> (com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.model.HibernateConfig=
uration).
> >> log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.
> >>=

> snip
> >>
> >> I have tried the following to get this working:
> >>
> >>=
 1) including log4j.properties on the classpath
> >> 2) removing it from th=
e classpath and specifying 
> >> -Dlog4j.properties=3D<full path to file> o=
n the Java command line
> >>
> >> I also had to edit the Junit excluded.pro=
perties file to exclude
> >> org.apache.commons.logging.* to get this far.
=
> >>
> >> In the classes I define the Log variables as follows:
> >>
> >> p=
rivate static Log logger =3D Logger.getLog(<classname>.class);
> >>
> >> Th=
is is really doing my head in as I can't see the log messages to 
> >> help=
 debug a problem in the Hibernate configuration.  Despite 
> >> spending ho=
urs searching the web and newsgroups for an 
> answer I can't find one.
> >=
>
> >> Can anyone help?
> >>
> >> Thanks,
> >>
> >> Charles.
> >
> >Charles=
:
> >
> >(This should really be on a log4j list, but oh well...)
> >
> >
> =
>I think this is because you are setting your root log level to info:
> >lo=
g4j.rootLogger=3Dinfo, stdout, file
> >
> >Whereas your app logs are set to=
 debug - so they don't have 
> an appender 
> >to go to.  Have you tried se=
tting the root level to debug?
> >- Rob
> >
